Package complexnumbers

Class Mafs

  • java.lang.Object
    • complexnumbers.Mafs
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Complex, Cpx
    public class Mafs
extends Object
    This class is used to hold certain mathematical constants, operations, and functions that will be useful for the Complex class.

      • ROOTPI2

        public static double ROOTPI2
        √(π)/2. Will be used in calculation of the erf function

        public static double log2
        ln(2)

      • logPI

        public static double logPI
        ln(π)

      • Mascheroni

        public static double Mascheroni
        The Euler-Mascheroni constant. It's just called Mascheroni because calling it Euler might cause people to confuse it for Euler's number.

      • unsplice

        public static String unsplice​(String s,
                              int chop1,
                              int chop2)
        Removes (or "unsplices") the substring between chop1 (inclusive) and chop2 (exclusive)
        Parameters:
        s - the input string
        chop1 - the starting index of the removed substring
        chop2 - the ending index of the removed substring (+1, like with iterators)
        Returns:
        the output string

      • str

        public static String str​(double dub)
        Converts a double to a string like a human would (without .0).
        Parameters:
        dub - input double
        Returns:
        output string

      • str

        public static String str​(double dub,
                         int dig)
        Converts a double to a string like a human would, but with a specific number of decimal places. (-1 defaults to the previous function)
        Parameters:
        dub - input double
        dig - number of digits
        Returns:
        output string

      • factorial

        public static long factorial​(int n)
        The factorial of an integer, represented with 64-bit longs. (returns 2^63-1 if it overflows)
        Parameters:
        n - input
        Returns:
        n!

      • pow

        public static double pow​(double d,
                         int a)
        Raises double to integer power. Calculated via exponentiation by squaring.
        Parameters:
        d - the base
        a - the exponent
        Returns:
        the base raised to the exponent

      • sgn

        public static int sgn​(double d)
        The sign (or signum) function.
        Parameters:
        d - the input
        Returns:
        1 if d is positive, -1 if d is negative, 0 if d is 0.

      • csgn

        public static int csgn​(double d)
        The complex sign function.
        Parameters:
        d - the input
        Returns:
        -1 if d is negative, 1 if non-negative

      • modPos

        public static double modPos​(double d1,
                            double d2)
        A variation of the modulo who's range is always from 0 to d2. When d2 is positive, the output will always be positive (or rather, non-negative), and since d2 is almost never negative, this function is called "modPos", standing for modulo positive.
        Parameters:
        d1 - the dividend
        d2 - the divisor
        Returns:
        the remainder

      • sin

        public static double sin​(double d)
        A slight variation of the sine. The variation makes it so, if the angle is a multiple of π, the output is always 0.
        Parameters:
        d - the input
        Returns:
        the sine

      • cos

        public static double cos​(double d)
        A slight variation of the cosine. The variation makes it so, if the angle is an odd multiple of π/2, the output is always 0.
        Parameters:
        d - the input
        Returns:
        the cosine

      • tan

        public static double tan​(double d)
        A slight variation of the tangent. The variation makes it so, if the angle is a multiple of π, the output is always 0, and if the angle is an odd multiple of π/2, the output is always ∞.
        Parameters:
        d - the input
        Returns:
        the tangent

      • fsinhcosh

        public static double[] fsinhcosh​(double d)
        Hyperbolic sine & cosine both computed simultaneously. The name is inspired by the FSINCOS instruction used in assembly code, which is slower than cos and slower than sin, but faster than doing them both. This function calculates the exponential and its reciprocal, then uses arithmetic to find the sinh and cosh.
        Parameters:
        d - the hyperbolic argument
        Returns:
        the array {sinh(d), cosh(d)}
